sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of natural disaster occurring in a region
message_1: The probability of an earthquake occurring in a certain city is 0.03 in any given year. What is the probability of at least one earthquake occurring in the next 10 years?
message_2:
To find the probability of at least one earthquake occurring in the next 10 years, we can first find the probability of no earthquakes occurring in the next 10 years and then subtract that from 1.

The probability of no earthquake in a given year is 1 - 0.03 = 0.97.

The probability of no earthquakes occurring in 10 consecutive years is (0.97)^10.

Now, we can find the probability of at least one earthquake occurring in the next 10 years by subtracting the probability of no earthquakes from 1:

Probability of at least one earthquake = 1 - (0.97)^10 â‰ˆ 0.262

So, there is approximately a 26.2% chance of at least one earthquake occurring in the next 10 years.
